connector.description:
Upload data to AWS S3.

The Kamelet expects the following headers to be set:

- `file` / `ce-file`: as the file name to upload

If the header won't be set the exchange ID will be used as file name.

camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.bucketNameOrAr.name: camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.bucketNameOrArn
camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.bucketNameOrAr.description: The S3 Bucket name or ARN.

camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.region.name: camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.region
camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.region.description: The AWS region to connect to. Example: eu-west-1

camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.autoCreateBuck.name: camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.autoCreateBucket
camel.kamelet.aws-s3-sink.autoCreateBuck.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName.
